channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Psychiatrists call for RFK Jr. to be replaced as health secretary
item.description: Two groups are calling for new leadership at HHS after Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s actions on substance abuse treatment and mental health...

item.title: Who is Larry Ellison, the billionaire Trump friend who's part of the TikTok takeover?
item.description: Larry Ellison has a lower profile than other tech billionaires, but his influence over media is about to be immense. His family's empire could soon ow...

item.title: ICC finds former Sudan militia leader guilty of war crimes in Darfur
item.description: The International Criminal Court in The Hague handed down its first-ever Darfur war crimes conviction, finding Janjaweed leader Ali Kushayb, guilty of...

item.title: Who is Bari Weiss? CBS News' new editor-in-chief is a vocal critic of legacy media
item.description: Provocative columnist Bari Weiss publicly quit the New York Times in 2020, then cofounded The Free Press as an alternative to legacy media. Here's wha...

item.title: Bread and Puppet Theater is still working to 'make the revolution irresistible'
item.description: The decades-old radical troupe Bread and Puppet, famed for its protest art including giant puppets, is touring again — mixing circus, politics and bre...

item.title: Shoe thrown at India's top judge in religious row
item.description: A lawyer attacks India's Chief Justice BR Gavai, apparently over remarks he made about Hinduism.

item.title: Report warns extremists increasingly using AI to intensify antisemitic propaganda
item.description: Secure Communities Network, a nonprofit group dedicated to safeguarding the Jewish community in North America, published the report on AI and antisemi...

item.title: Trump and Brazilian President Lula have 'friendly' call
item.description: Brazil's government said the two "reminisced about the good chemistry" they had at the UN in New York.

item.title: Illinois, Chicago sue to block National Guard, but troops already deployed
item.description: Illinois and Chicago have sued the Trump administration to block deployment of the National Guard to Chicago, though it was revealed in court that tro...

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects Ghislaine Maxwell appeal in Epstein case
item.description: The British socialite is serving a 20-year prison sentence on sex-trafficking charges related to former boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Chicago and Illinois sue to stop Trump’s Guard deployment plan after Portland ruling
item.description: Illinois and Chicago have filed a lawsuit aiming to stop President Donald Trump’s administration from sending hundreds of National Guard troops to Chi...

item.title: France in fresh political crisis as PM Lecornu quits after 26 days
item.description: Lecornu was asked by President Macron to stay on until Wednesday in a last-ditch attempt to achieve "stability" for the country.

item.title: Air traffic controllers told to keep working during government shutdown
item.description: National Air Traffic Controllers Association tells its members that failing to report to work could cost them their job.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from sending troops from California to Portland
item.description: The decision late on Sunday comes a day after the same judge barred the deployment of troops from the state of Oregon.

item.title: Speaker Johnson says it’s up to Democrats to ‘stop the madness’ on shutdown’s sixth day
Supreme Court rejects appeal from Ghislaine Maxwell, imprisoned former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein
Ex-NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez charged with felony over violent altercation
item.description: Mark Sanchez was hospitalized with multiple stab wounds following a violent altercation over the weekend.
